column4: does anyone know where i might be able to look for documentation on psmouse module?
the kernel sources, if it's included in the kernel, see the /Documentation dir
modinfo psmouse might help as well
hbekel:many thanks! will look now!
i'm trying to undo 'modprobe -r psmouse' and 'modprobe psmouse proto=imps' any ideas?
ideas about what?
about how to reset to default?
my keyboard and mouse are disabled
about how to reset them to their default? i've managed to lock myself out of my keyboard and trackpad!
the psmouse module probably has nothing to do with it
it's rather xorg i'd guess
i think it does - see http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=7800070
after reset it stopped working
and now i'm trying to undo what i did as root in safe mode
to undo the proto action you can 'modprobe -r psmouse; and modprobe psmouse' again
that should use only the options (if any) defined via the modprobe.conf mechanism
thanks for your advice - i just tried it and the keyboard and tracker are still disabled...
i'll try just disabling psmouse
perhaps its not enabled at all by default
hmm, no idea, sorry. got to go, too...
thanks for your help!
